resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/104946</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>104946</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770206925</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">From Slavery to Freedom, 1824-1909</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Von Sklaverei zu Freiheit, 1824-1909</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">De l'esclavage à la liberté, 1824-1909</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Do slavery à liberdade, 1824-1909</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Da slavery a libertà, 1824-1909</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Από τη σκλαβιά στην ελευθερία, 1824-1909</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">De esclavitud a la libertad, 1824-1909</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">presents nearly 400 pamphlets written by African-Americans and others about slavery, emancipation, African colonization, Reconstruction, and related topics. Materials range from personal accounts and to reports and legislative speeches. Authors include Frederick Douglass, Charles Sumner, Mary Church Terrell, Booker T. Washington, and others.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Social Sciences</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Geschenke fast 400 Flugschriften geschrieben von 
Afrikanisch-African-Americans und von anderen über Sklaverei, 
Emanzipation, afrikanische Besiedlung, Rekonstruktion und in 
Verbindung gestandene Themen. Materialien erstrecken sich von 
den persönlichen Konten und zu den Reports und zu den gesetzgebenden 
Reden. Autoren enthalten Frederick Douglass, Charles Sumner, 
Mary Kirche Terrell, Booker T. Washington und andere.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">présents presque 400 brochures écrites par des 
Afro-Américains et d'autres au sujet de l'esclavage, de l'émancipation, 
de la colonisation africaine, de la reconstruction, et des sujets 
associés. Les matériaux s'étendent des comptes personnels et 
aux états et aux discours législatifs. Les auteurs incluent 
Frederick Douglass, Charles Sumner, église de Mary Terrell, Booker T.
Washington, et d'autres.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">presentes quase 400 panfletos escritos por 
Africano-Americano e por outro sobre o slavery, o emancipation, a 
colonização africana, o reconstruction, e tópicos relacionados. 
Os materiais variam dos clientes pessoais e aos relatórios e 
aos discursos legislativos. Os autores incluem Frederick 
Douglass, Charles Sumner, igreja Terrell, Booker T. Washington, e 
outro de Mary.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">presenti quasi 400 opuscoli scritti da 
Africano-African-Americans e da altri circa slavery, emancipazione, 
colonizzazione africana, ricostruzione ed i soggetti attinenti. 
I materiali variano dai clienti personali ed ai rapporti ed ai 
discorsi legislativi. Gli autori includono Frederick Douglass, 
Charles Sumner, chiesa Terrell, Booker T. Washington ed altri della 
Mary.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">παρουσιάζει σχεδόν 400 τεύχη που γράφονται από 
African-Americans και άλλα για τη σκλαβιά, την χειραφέτηση, 
την αφρικανική αποίκιση, την αναδημιουργία, και τα σχετικά 
θέματα. Τα υλικά κυμαίνονται από τους προσωπικούς 
απολογισμούς και στις εκθέσεις και τις νομοθετικές ομιλίες. 
Οι συντάκτες περιλαμβάνουν Frederick Douglass, 
Charles Sumner, Mary Church Terrell, Booker Τ. 
Ουάσιγκτον, και άλλα.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">presentes casi 400 folletos escritos por 
Africano-african-Americans y otros sobre esclavitud, la emancipación,
la colonización africana, la reconstrucción, y asuntos relacionados.
Los materiales se extienden de cuentas personales y a los 
informes y a los discursos legislativos. Los autores incluyen 
Frederick Douglass, Charles Sumner, iglesia Terrell, Booker T. 
Washington, y otros de Maria.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Sozialwissenschaften</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Les Sciences Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ciências Sociais</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Scienze Sociali</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Κοινωνικές επιστήμες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Ciencias Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770206925</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Custom License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>104946</entry>
    </identifier>
    <name>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/courses/from-slavery-to-freedom-1824-1909</uri>
      </location>
    </item>
  </manifestation>
</expression>
